title: `forge create` and `forge build` does not report error when code size exceeds 24576 bytes
body:
### Component

Forge

### Have you ensured that all of these are up to date?

- [X] Foundry
- [X] Foundryup

### What version of Foundry are you on?

forge 0.1.0 (98f0771 2022-02-25T00:34:31.840096006+00:00)

### What command(s) is the bug in?

forge create

### Operating System

Linux

### Describe the bug

When using `forge create --optimize --optimize-runs 20000` and `forge build --optimize --optimize-runs 20000` on these [contracts](https://github.com/NFT-Worlds/NFT-Worlds-Staking-Rental-Contract) there's no error reported. However both remix and hardhat report error "Warning: Contract code size is 28394 bytes and exceeds 24576 bytes"

As a result the deployed contracts cannot be verified on etherscan.

For which contracts are you facing this? I just cloned and ran `forge b --optimize-runs 20000 --force`:

We disable contract size warnings for test contracts >24KB since they are not intended to be deployed
@gakonst if forge doesn't report on oversized contracts, how should the user know? Am I missing something?
_test_ contracts are not supposed to be deployed, so we do not report that warning as it's pointless and ends up cluttering your screen, we are reporting warnings otherwise
